subject: Ethics
title: Climate Refugees and Justice
description: A short lesson to help you apply Climate Refugees and Justice.

hook.text: Tuvalu is sinking. Its 11,000 people may lose their country entirely to rising seas by 2100.

buildup.text: Climate change displaces millionsâ€”floods, droughts, and storms force people from their homes.

discovery.text: Yet 'climate refugee' isn't a legal category. The 1951 Refugee Convention doesn't cover environmental displacement.

twist.text: The nations producing the least emissions are losing the most land. The biggest polluters accept the fewest refugees.

climax.text: Without legal recognition, climate refugees have no guaranteed right to shelter in another country.

punchline.text: They didn't cause the flood, but they drown in it.

quiz.question: Why is the term 'climate refugee' legally problematic?
options: Climate change doesn't actually displace people
The 1951 Refugee Convention doesn't cover environmental displacement
All climate refugees are already protected under existing law
